com.sun.darkstar.example.snowman.game.task.state.battle
Class MoveCharacterTask

java.lang.Object
  com.sun.darkstar.example.snowman.game.task.Task
      com.sun.darkstar.example.snowman.game.task.RealTimeTask
          com.sun.darkstar.example.snowman.game.task.state.battle.MoveCharacterTask
All Implemented Interfaces:
IRealTimeTask, ITask
public class MoveCharacterTask
extends RealTimeTask

MoveCharacterTask extends RealTimeTask to set the destination of the user controlled CharacterEntity.

MoveCharacterTask execution logic: 1. Reset the velocity of the character. 2. Find the click position based on screen coordinates. 3. Find and set the valid destination based on clicked position. 4. Store the destination in the character. 5. Send server a 'moveme' packet. 6. Rotate the character to face the destination. 7. Add a movement force to the character based on the direction. 8. Mark the character with PhysicsManager for update. 9. Set the character state to moving and mark for update.

Two MoveCharacterTask are considered 'equal' if and only if both of them are setting on the same CharacterEntity.

Version:
Creation date: 07-21-2008 15:58 EST, Modified date: 07-24-2008 16:33 EST
Author:
Yi Wang (Neakor)
